moves.1. c4 c5 2. Nc3 e6 3. e3 Nc6 4. Nf3 a6 5: 6....Nf6 develops and fights for the center.
moves.8. Qe2: better is: 8.dxe6 dxe 9.Qxd8+ displacing Black's king.
moves.9. Ne5: oops. Stronger is 9.dxe6 dxe6 10.Nd5 threatening the Black Queen. gains tempo.
moves.10. Bf4 Nf6 11. b3: OOPS! that pawn on c4 is well defended. to be preferred is 11.dxe dxe 12.Rc1
moves.12... bxc4: 12....Bb7 is better than the text, but 12....g4 is aggressive and strong.  i.e. 12....g5 13.dxe dxe and Nxf7 becomes necessary.
moves.13. Nxc4 Nxc4 14. Qxc4 Bxf4 15. Qxc7: double ?? Ooops. Gives Black a piece advantage. 15.gxf4 is necessary.
moves.18. Rad1 exd5: both ...Ba5 and ...Be5 as previous note are more effective way of getting the pawn.
moves.19. Nxd5 Nxd5 20. Bxd5 Bxd5 21. Rxd5 d6: If white can swap all the pawns off, game is draw. If White can advance both qside pawns, he may be able to  win this.
moves.29... Kh7 30. Rxc5 Ba7 31. Rc1: better is 31.Rc7 winning the f7 pawn.
moves.32... Rxf2 33. Rc7 Bb6 34. Rb7 Bd4 35. K: better is 38....Rb4 threatening to swap out the Rooks.
moves.39. b6 Ra1+ 40. Kg2 Ra2+ 41. Kh3 g4+: 41....Bg1 is mate in a few moves.
moves.42. Kh4 Kg6 43. Re6+ Bf6+: 43...Kf5 leads to mate quickly or gains the rook. Threat is ...Rh2+mate.
